thread.title: Sydney tops world's friendliest cities list with tourists
thread.title_full: Sydney tops world's friendliest cities list with tourists | Daily Mail Online

author: Emily Crane for Daily Mail Australia
title: Sydney tops world's friendliest cities list with tourists
text:
1.2k shares 46
View
comments
With its harbour views and iconic beaches Sydney has been named as the world's friendliest city for tourists for 2015.
Sydney was voted in as the top city by readers of luxury travel magazine Condé Nast Traveler in its annual rankings.
Those who voted claimed there was 'nothing not to like' in Sydney.
Sydney was voted in as the the world's friendliest city for tourists for 2015 by readers of luxury travel magazine Condé Nast Traveler in its annual rankings.
'Such friendly people... so much so that after we met an Australian woman on our flight there, she offered to pick us up at our hotel and spent a whole day showing us her favourite parts of the city,' one visitor said.
Tours of Sydney Harbour topped the list of things to do in Sydney, including boat tours and climbing the iconic bridge.
Sydney tied for fifth place in the friendliest city for 2014 with Melbourne taking out the top spot.
Sydney (pictured Bondi Beach) was voted in as the top city by readers of luxury travel magazine Condé Nast Traveler in its annual rankings
The Victorian city failed the make the top 10 list this year.
Dublin in Ireland came in just behind Sydney and New Zealand's Queenstown was third.
Queenstown was hailed for being 'the birthplace of adventure tourism - 50 ways to kill yourself every day!' as well as its bar scene and glaciers.
WORLD'S FRIENDLIEST CITIES 1. Sydney, Australia
2. Dublin, Ireland
3. Queenstown, New Zealand
4. Kraków, Poland
5. Bruges, Belgium
6. Edinburgh, Scotland
7. Kyoto, Japan
8. Budapest, Hungary
9. Auckland, New Zealand
10. Reykjavik, Iceland
WORLD'S UNFRIENDLIEST CITIES 1. Caracas, Venezuela
2. Casablanca, Morocco
3. Guangzhou, China
4. Guatemala City, Guatemala
5. Nairobi, Kenya
6. New Delhi, India
7. Cairo, Egypt
8. Moscow, Russia
9. Jakarta, Indonesia
10. Cannes, France
The magazine also ranked the least friendliest cities in the world with Caracas, Venezuela taking out the top spot.
It was followed by Casablanca in Morocco and Guangzhou in China.
The rankings are determined by Conde Nast Traveler's annual Reader Choice Awards survey.
Tours of Sydney Harbour topped the list of things to do in Sydney, including boat tours and climbing the iconic bridge. Sydney tied for fifth place in the friendliest city for 2014 with Melbourne taking out the top spot
